body.head: Available Programs
body.p: There are several programs that help you repeat vocabularies on the smartphone. To get an overview of available tools have a look at Wikipedia. We provide some data for ANKI and Flashcards Deluxe.

div.head: ANKI
div.p: ... is a spaced repetition flashcard program. "Anki" is Japanese for memorization. You can find details about the program on Wikipedia.
You can download the program from the AnkiWeb webiste. If you want to synch your learning progress over the internet you might consider registering with ankiweb.

As a quick start we provide a template "deck" with all the required settings called Empty 4 by 4. By importing this template into Anki you get
the andika font installed (doesn't show on OS X though) and
a "note" design with 4 fields on the front side and 4 on the back side of a card.
After the setup you can start importing vocabulary data.

div.head: Flashcards Deluxe
div.p: The program for is available for iOS and for Android. Their homepage has some advice on how to use the software in different scenarios.
You can use Dropbox or Google Drive as a cloud storage to quickly up- and download new vocabularies and keep a copy of your learning progress on the internet.

list.item: Open Flashcards Deluxe and touch the + sign on top of the screen.
Choose Dropbox or Google Drive and supply your respective user credentials.
Flashcards Deluxe creates a folder in either cloud storage that will contain the vocabulary data and your progress statistics.

div.p: For iOS there fortunately is no need to do any further Setup. All characters are present in the fonts preinstalled on every iOS device. With the fonts installed on Android, you will usually not be able to see all the letters used in the VICAV or DMG transcriptions. However Flashcards deluxe can use a font provided by the user. A font that can be used is the Andika font provided by SIL.

list.item:
The file Andika-R.ttf should go into the following directory on your phone:
/Android/data/com.orangeorapple.flashcards/files/fonts

If you only try the demo the folder is:
/Android/data//com.orangeorapple.flashcardslite/files/fonts
If Flashcards Deluxe is running you have to restart it.
